subject: Re: [junit] 5 Open Source Java projects with "sufficient" JUnit tests?
msgSnippet: Harald, At Agitar we have run coverage reports of a number of open source projects (see www.agitar.com/openquality). It is indeed not trivial to do so
messageBody:
Harald,

At Agitar we have run coverage reports of a number of
open source projects (see www.agitar.com/openquality).
It is indeed not trivial to do so reliably, so we
still refer to this as a beta project.

But you will find a couple of projects that meet your
specs (like berkeleydb, checkstyle, cruisecontrol,
lucene) that do a good job of unit testing. The
dashboards will give you the numbers you asked for.

-Mark de Visser
Agitar Software


--- Harald Mueller <harald.m.mueller@...>
wrote:

> Hi -
> for trying out what coverage means (first, for me
> ... then maybe for us?)
> with unit testing (with various tools, among others
> my [not yet public]
> addition of "hansel categories" of Hansel), I would
> like to have around 5
> not-too-small (say >= 50 classes, >= a few 100
> methods) open source with
> "good" unit tests.
> I started wading through Sourceforge, but it's quite
> tedious ... If someone
> can me point to such projects, that would be really
> nice!
> Thanks
> Harald M. Mueller
>
> --
> HA
